author: Emma Munbodh
title: Your 'free' Waitrose hot drink is changing - and it's not good news for freeloaders
text:
Waitrose are curbing their free tea and coffee offer (Photo: Getty / Waitrose) Share Get money updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Waitrose is to "refine" its offer of free tea and coffee for members of its loyalty card scheme by offering the hot drink to paying customers only. 
Currently, myWaitrose card holders can collect their hot beverage as they enter the supermarket and enjoy it as they shop in the aisles. 
But, an email sent to customers on 21 March says they will be asked to confirm they have made a purchase before picking up their free drink from April 3 2017. 
A spokesman said shoppers will be given a cup as they go through the checkout. 
There will continue to be no minimum spend requirement - meaning customers can redeem their hot drink for as little as the cost of a pack of chewing gum. 
Waitrose said the change was "just a refinement" to the offer. poll loading Have you ever claimed a free drink from Waitrose? 0+ VOTES SO FAR YES NO 
It said over the past six months, the store has undergone a trial, advising customers to make a purchase - this has now become compulsory. 
The email to customers says: "Our myWaitrose free tea and coffee offer is one of the ways we thank our customers for shopping with us - and we want all our customers to be able to enjoy a free hot drink when they shop with us in our branches. 
"From 3 April, we'll simply be asking myWaitrose members to make a purchase before collecting their cup at the checkout. 
"We would like to thank you in advance for your understanding." 
But, customers aren't happy. 
One unhappy shopper took to online deals forum HotUKDeals this morning to say: "I watch a lot of people going in to get the coffee for free and a lot were pensioners" 
Another, implied they were surprised the Waitrose deal lasted this long. 
"Surprised they didn't do this at the outset!" Waitrose customers will now have to pay first, and drink later (Photo: Waitrose) 
In 2015 Waitrose scrapped a tea and coffee free-for-all which allowed myWaitrose members to enjoy a hot drink for nothing in its cafes even if they had bought nothing else. 
Members of the scheme were told that if they wished to enjoy a free tea or coffee in one of its caf√©s they must also purchase a "treat" such as "a sandwich, cake, biscuit or piece of fruit". 
"This change will enable us to continue to offer our customers the enjoyable service they expect," the email said. 
The store brushed off the suggestion that the 2015 change was in response to reports that Waitrose was facing a middle-class backlash from customers upset that the stores were being invaded by less well-off shoppers. Read More How to get a free tea or coffee EVERY DAY - and there's not even a catch The move follows complaints from customers that the deal was creating unnecessary queues and attracting the 'wrong kind of people'. Before the decision was made, some Waitrose shoppers shared their disdain for people coming in for free coffee. Jacques wrote on Twitter: "Urgh, opening time at Waitrose. Need to fight through the crowds of chavs desperate for a free coffee." And one woman wrote: "Please don't turn into a 'soup kitchen' handing out free drinks. "The usual clientele of Waitrose are hardly strapped for cash." While a person in Hertfordshire, tweeted: "Bit disconcerting seeing people carrying cups of hot coffee around Waitrose whilst they text and push trolleys with their bellies." But, one twitter wrote this morning, that the news will be like an "earthquake" for freebie hunters. To view all of the MyWaitrose perks, visit Waitrose.com/home/mywaitrose . Like us on Facebook
